title: 110_hr6091
content: The "Save Medicare Act of 2008" is the short title of this legislation. It includes an increase in Medicare physician payment updates. Section 1848(d) of the Social Security Act is amended to update the single conversion factor for Medicare physician payment in 2009. In 2009, the single conversion factor for Medicare physician payment will be updated by 1.8 percent. SEC. 3. Extension of the Physician Quality Reporting System. The text discusses amendments to the Social Security Act and the Tax Relief and Health Care Act regarding reporting and system changes for the years 2009 and 2010. Amendment to the Medicare, Medicaid, and SCHIP Extension Act of 2007 for the years 2008 and 2009 includes changes in reporting requirements and system updates. The Medicare Incentive Payment Program for Physician Scarcity Areas is extended to January 1, 2010. Additionally, the floor on Medicare work geographic adjustment under the Medicare Physician Fee Schedule is also extended. Section 1848(e)(1) of the Social Security Act is amended to change dates from July 1, 2008, to January 1, 2010. Section 1842(b)(6)(D)(iii) is also amended to change dates. Additionally, there is a sense of Congress regarding fiscal responsibility. Congress believes that this Act should be deficit neutral over a 5-year period starting in October 2008 and that challenges facing the Medicare program should be addressed in a fiscally responsible manner. Congress believes that the Medicare program should provide positive incentives for health professionals to participate in initiatives to improve healthcare quality, including pay-for-reporting programs and coordination of care. Financing for these initiatives should be non-punitive and exempt from budget neutrality requirements.
